message_1: In a group of 8 people, how many different ways can 3 people be selected to form a committee?
message_2:
To determine the number of ways to select 3 people from a group of 8, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8 in this case) and k is the number of people to be selected (3 in this case).

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!5!)

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 3) = 336 / 6

C(8, 3) = 56

So there are 56 different ways to select 3 people from a group of 8 to form a committee.
